text.section:
In this section, "small procurement" means a procurement for which:
a unit spends $25,000 or less;
a contractor provides services subject to § 11-202(3) of this article for expected annual revenues of $25,000 or less; or
the Department of General Services is seeking to award a procurement contract for a construction with a value that is $50,000 or less.
A unit may make small procurements in accordance with the regulations of primary procurement units.
A primary procurement unit may not create a small procurement by artificial division of a procurement.

Any regulation of a primary procurement unit to govern small procurements:
shall provide for a simplified administrative procedure;
shall be consistent with the basic intent of this Division II; and
may not be disadvantageous economically to the State.

At least every 3 years, the Board shall:
review the prevailing costs of labor and materials; and
if warranted by changes in cost, recommend to the General Assembly appropriate adjustments in the ceiling for a small procurement.
